intro: Stillingia bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed stellaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Stellariaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive two-toothed appearance at the base, giving it its common name. Stillingia bidentata is often found in moist soils and can thrive in a variety of temperate climates.
